summary: Dr. Haroon I. Hameed was found guilty of unprofessional conduct, habitual intoxication, addiction to controlled dangerous substances (CDS), and providing professional services while under the influence of alcohol or CDS. Allegations included multiple instances of practicing while intoxicated, a DUI, and altering a patient's consent form. His medical license was reprimanded and indefinitely suspended, contingent on his enrollment and compliance with the Maryland Professional Rehabilitation Program, followed by a minimum of three years of probation.
